name: Memory Management
description: Handles memory storage and retrieval using a database. It has two types of memories: general and specific. Specific memories are stored in a Hashmap, and can be retrieved by a key.
author: Shinkai

database_name.description: By default, the database name is the app_id. You can specify a different name to share the same database in multiple contexts.

data.description: The data to process for memory management, if not provided, the tool will return existing memories

memory_key.description: Optional. The Hashmap 'key' for specific memory retrieval. For example a user name or email.

general_prompt.description: Optional. The general prompt for generating memories. Default: 'Synthesize important information to remember from this interaction'

specific_prompt.description: Optional. The specific prompt for generating memories. Default: 'Synthesize important information to remember from this interaction'

sqlTables.name: memory_table
sqlTables.definition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS memory_table (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, date DATETIME DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP, key TEXT, memory TEXT)

sqlQueries.name: Get general memory
sqlQueries.query: SELECT id, key, memory FROM memory_table WHERE key IS NULL

sqlQueries.name: Get specific memory
sqlQueries.query: SELECT id, key, memory FROM memory_table WHERE key = ?

sqlQueries.name: Update memory
sqlQueries.query: UPDATE memory_table SET memory = ? WHERE id = ?
